titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL379_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL379_01

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

div.tei:ab:
Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.w-ndb | w-hq[šb | ... ... | g]n[ʾ] 2.[m]brʾm | ḥśśm | w-(ʾ) 3.gnʾ-hw | w-ṣwbt-hw | w-[mḥfdt-hw | bn |] mr 4.ḫdʿw | w-hʿqbw | l-ḫlf-hw | [m]ṣ[rʿ]tm | [m]brʾ | 5.b-mqm | mrʾ-hmw | ʿṯtr-[šr]qn | 6. | b-wrḫn | ḏ-qyẓn | [ḏ-b-ḫ]r[fn].
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[ysrm | yhnʿm | w-bn-hw | šmr | yhrʿš | mlky | sbʾ | w-ḏ-rydn | ... ... |] w-ndb | w-hq[šb | ... ... | g]n[ʾ | w-ṣwbt | w-mḥfdt | hgr-hmw] 2.[hkrm | w-hdbw-hw | w-brʾ | w-ḥẓyn | mbrʾ ... ... m]brʾm | ḥśśm | w-(ʾ)[bnm | ....m | w-wśfw | w-rymw | kl | gnʾ-hw | w-ṣwbt-] 3.[hw | w-mḥfdt-hw | ḏ-ṯny | sqfyn | w-ḏ-sqfm | b-ʿ... ...]gnʾ-hw | w-ṣwbt-hw | w-[mḥfdt-hw | bn |] mr[ym-hw | ʿdy | ṯrt-hw | w-hdbw-hw | w-hʿqbn] 4.[gnʾm | qšbm | w-hmrw-hw | w-šrʿw-hw | ḫṭln | ... ...]ḫdʿw | w-hʿqbw | l-ḫlf-hw | [m]ṣ[rʿ]tm | [m]brʾ | [w-mqyḥ | kl | ṣdqm | bn | mwṯrm | ʿdy | t=] 5.[frʿm | b-mlʾ | ʿšrt | ymtm | bn | wrḫn | ḏ-mbkrn | ... ...]b-mqm | mrʾ-hmw | ʿṯtr-[šr]qn | [w-ʾšms-hmw | w-ʾlʾlt-hmw | w-b-ʾḫyl | w-mqymt | ḫmys] 6.[ḏ-rydn | w-hrṯdw | hgr-hmw | hkrm | b-tḥ... ...] | b-wrḫn | ḏ-qyẓn | [ḏ-b-ḫ]r[fn | ḏ-l-sṯt] | w-[ṯsʿy | w-ṯlṯ | mʾtm | bn | ḫrf | mbḥḍ | bn | ʾbḥḍ].

hkrm | w-hdbw-hw | w-brʾ | w-ḥẓyn | mbrʾ mbrʾm | ḥśśm | w-ʾ bnm | ....m | w-wśfw | w-rymw | kl | gnʾ-hw | w-ṣwbt-
hw | w-mḥfdt-hw | ḏ-ṯny | sqfyn | w-ḏ-sqfm | b-ʿ gnʾ-hw | w-ṣwbt-hw | w-mḥfdt-hw | bn | mrym-hw | ʿdy | ṯrt-hw | w-hdbw-hw | w-hʿqbn

w-ndb w-hqšb gnʾ
mbrʾm ḥśśm w-ʾ
gnʾ-hw w-ṣwbt-hw w-mḥfdt-hw bn mr
ḫdʿw w-hʿqbw l-ḫlf-hw mṣrʿtm mbrʾ
b-mqm mrʾ-hmw ʿṯtr-šrqn
b-wrḫn ḏ-qyẓn ḏ-b-ḫrfn.
Restored full text of the inscription:
ysrm yhnʿm w-bn-hw šmr yhrʿš mlky sbʾ w-ḏ-rydn w-ndb w-hqšb gnʾ w-ṣwbt w-mḥfdt hgr-hmw
hkrm w-hdbw-hw w-brʾ w-ḥẓyn mbrʾ mbrʾm ḥśśm w-ʾbnm ....m w-wśfw w-rymw kl gnʾ-hw w-ṣwbt-
hw w-mḥfdt-hw ḏ-ṯny sqfyn w-ḏ-sqfm b-ʿgnʾ-hw w-ṣwbt-hw w-mḥfdt-hw bn mrym-hw ʿdy ṯrt-hw w-hdbw-hw w-hʿqbn
gnʾm qšbm w-hmrw-hw w-šrʿw-hw ḫṭln ḫdʿw w-hʿqbw l-ḫlf-hw mṣrʿtm mbrʾ w-mqyḥ kl ṣdqm bn mwṯrm ʿdy t=
frʿm b-mlʾ ʿšrt ymtm bn wrḫn ḏ-mbkrn b-mqm mrʾ-hmw ʿṯtr-šrqn w-ʾšms-hmw w-ʾlʾlt-hmw w-b-ʾḫyl w-mqymt ḫmys

mbrʾm ḥśśm w-ʾ

Restored full text of the inscription:
ysrm yhnʿm w-bn-hw šmr yhrʿš mlky sbʾ w-ḏ-rydn w-ndb w-hqšb gnʾ w-ṣwbt w-mḥfdt hgr-hmw
hkrm w-hdbw-hw w-brʾ w-ḥẓyn mbrʾ mbrʾm ḥśśm w-ʾbnm ....m w-wśfw w-rymw kl gnʾ-hw w-ṣwbt-
hw w-mḥfdt-hw ḏ-ṯny sqfyn w-ḏ-sqfm b-ʿgnʾ-hw w-ṣwbt-hw w-mḥfdt-hw bn mrym-hw ʿdy ṯrt-hw w-hdbw-hw w-hʿqbn
gnʾm qšbm w-hmrw-hw w-šrʿw-hw ḫṭln ḫdʿw w-hʿqbw l-ḫlf-hw mṣrʿtm mbrʾ w-mqyḥ kl ṣdqm bn mwṯrm ʿdy t=
frʿm b-mlʾ ʿšrt ymtm bn wrḫn ḏ-mbkrn b-mqm mrʾ-hmw ʿṯtr-šrqn w-ʾšms-hmw w-ʾlʾlt-hmw w-b-ʾḫyl w-mqymt ḫmys
ḏ-rydn w-hrṯdw hgr-hmw hkrm b-tḥ b-wrḫn ḏ-qyẓn ḏ-b-ḫrfn ḏ-l-sṯt w-ṯsʿy w-ṯlṯ mʾtm bn ḫrf mbḥḍ bn ʾbḥḍ.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.and constructed and bui[lt ... ... the w]al[l] 2.[a construction] in mud-brick and [in stone ... ...]. And they increased 3.its wall and its glacis and its towers from its upper 4.they repaired and reinforced for its gate door-leaves and a construction 5.by the power of their lord, ʿAthtar [Shāri]qān 6.in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān (i.e. June) [of the] ye[ar]
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Yāsirum Yuhanʿim and his on Shammar Yuharʿish, the two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān … …] and constructed and bui[lt ... ... the w]al[l and the glacis and the towers of their town] 2.[of Hakirum, and they built it and constructed and completed the construction … …] a construction in mud-brick and [in stone ... ...]. And they increased [and built high its wall and its glacis] 3.[and its towers with two roofs and with a roof in … ...] its wall and its glacis and its towers from its upper [part to its foundation. And they constructed it and added] 4.[a new wall, and they provided it with an access route and they equipped it, (that is,) the ḫṭln-structure, ... ...] they repaired and reinforced for its gate door-leaves and a construction [and a completion with all accuracy, from the foundation to the] 5.[the top-(this) in the space of ten days from the month of Dhū-Mubakkirān (i.e. May) ... ...] by the power of their lord, ʿAthtar [Shāri]qān [and their protective goddesses and their (other) gods, and by the resources and the authority of the armies] 6.[of Raydān. And they committed their town of Hakirum … … …] in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān (i.e. June) [of the] ye[ar 396 of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ].

Text preserved in this squeeze:
and constructed and built the wall
a construction in mud-brick and in stone . And they increased
its wall and its glacis and its towers from its upper
they repaired and reinforced for its gate door-leaves and a construction
by the power of their lord, ʿAthtar Shāriqān
in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān i.e. June of the year
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yāsirum Yuhanʿim and his on Shammar Yuharʿish, the two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān … … and constructed and built the wall and the glacis and the towers of their town
of Hakirum, and they built it and constructed and completed the construction … … a construction in mud-brick and in stone . And they increased and built high its wall and its glacis
and its towers with two roofs and with a roof in … ... its wall and its glacis and its towers from its upper part to its foundation. And they constructed it and added
a new wall, and they provided it with an access route and they equipped it, that is, the ḫṭln-structure, they repaired and reinforced for its gate door-leaves and a construction and a completion with all accuracy, from the foundation to the
the top-this in the space of ten days from the month of Dhū-Mubakkirān i.e. May by the power of their lord, ʿAthtar Shāriqān and their protective goddesses and their other gods, and by the resources and the authority of the armies
of Raydān. And they committed their town of Hakirum … … … in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān i.e. June of the year
of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ.

Text preserved in this squeeze:

of Raydān. And they committed their town of Hakirum … … … in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān i.e. June of the year
of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ.

of Hakirum, and they built it and constructed and completed the construction … … a construction in mud-brick and in stone . And they increased and built high its wall and its glacis

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
